messages.title: Re-elect Ian Murray
messages.content: Getting things done for Marchmont and Sciennes

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Developing a 'Tenement Living' initiative to look at HMOs, repairs, cleaning and neighbour issues
Worked with Council colleagues to deliver extra capacity at James Gillespie's Primary and new James Gillespie's High
Continue to campaign for more and better cycle routes
Campaigning to alter planning laws to prevent tenement roof and garden expansions without all owner consent

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only Ian can stop the SNP in Edinburgh South

issues.brexitEurope: Backed by grass roots campaigners Britain for leading the fight against hard Brexit
issues.education: Worked with Council colleagues to deliver extra capacity at James Gillespie's Primary and new James Gillespie's High
issues.health: Representing local residents in discussions with NHS Lothian about appropriate use of Sick Kids site

community.content: Developing a 'Tenement Living' initiative to look at HMOs, repairs, cleaning and neighbour issues
Campaigning to alter planning laws to prevent tenement roof and garden expansions without all owner consent

politicalExperience.achievements: Helped over 15,000 constituents directly, Spoken to over 27,000 people in conversations on their doorsteps, Offered every household a home visit and 10,000 more since 2015, Over 1,000 open advice sessions - more than any other MP, Award-winning eMagazine for Community Engagement, Rated the most responsive MP in Scotland and 15th out of 650 MPs in the UK by independent charity MySociety

endorsements.endorser: Robin Harper, Former Convenor of the Scottish Green Party
endorsements.endorsement: "This election has every connection with the interests of the Conservative party and their increasing connection with the Green philosophy. The Green party has decided not to run a candidate here to save our nation."

quotes.text: Backed by grass roots campaigners Britain for leading the fight against hard Brexit
"[the SNP candidate] is hoping that as long as Tory voters keep voting Tory, the SNP will be able to push through the middle and win."
